newsitem.title: ZAMBIA: Zambia plans gemstones exchange to boost exports.
newsitem.headline: Zambia plans gemstones exchange to boost exports.

text.p: Zambia will establish a gemstone exchange this year to boost exports, which in 1996 increased by 48 percent from the previous year, the government said.
The Zambian government said in its 1996 economic report that gemstone exports were likely to increase in 1997 with the establishment of a gemstone exchange to streamline the marketing of gemstones.
"To this effect, the Zambia Gemstone Exchange Ltd, which will operate the exchange, was incorporated in 1996," it said.
The exchange would be a "one stop centre...which will bring together both buyers and sellers of gemstones on a more permanent and standardised basis".
It will be jointly owned by the government and business, which was last year invited to buy shares in it.
Reported gemstone export sales increased to $11.8 million in 1996 from $8.0 million in 1995, largely as a result of more liberal economic policies.

"The increase was due to an expanded production as well as to an open and free marketing system that permitted both producers and dealers to trade unfettered, both domestically and abroad," the report said.
Zambia is an exporter of emeralds, aquamarine, beryl, garnets and amethyst.
